title: Stone on type design
content:
Sumner Stone is publishing some very interesting articles on type & letterforms history and practice in his "Alphanet Journal" online. I have found the latter two of particular interest:

[http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/warpwoof1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100119161558/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/warpwoof1.html "http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/warpwoof1.html")

[http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/letterslost1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100119161558/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/letterslost1.html "http://www.stonetypefoundry.com/letterslost1.html")

One of the most interesting facet in both writings is Stone's growing concern towards pre-Roman letter shapes, an unlikely approach in today's typography, I guess.
author: ncaleffi
